Description: Furnishing(?); fragment; One end of a small cloth, mainly plain linen. Three decorative stripes, in dark and light blue and undyed threads (from the fringe inwards, respectively 15, 4 and 1-3 cms wide); design of small dotted lozenges. In stripes, weft consists of passes of two complementary lats, each lat mostly passing over three threads, under two, over one, under two etc., but this course being reversed and adjusted to form lozenges. Simple tabby and compound tabby. Warp: linen, S-spun, ca 13 threads/cm. Weft: linen (undyed and pale blue), S-spun, cotton (undyed and dark blue), ca 12 picks/cm in plain areas, ca 14 passes/cm in stripes. Edges: one simple fringe, two selvedge, 4th side fragmentary.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
